item.title: I need help w/ Java
item.dc:creator: @Cheese_Police c|p
item.description:
@Cheese_Police wrote:

[quote=“masterp00n, post:10, topic:78771”]I got to check right now…Well tell yah the truth im doing the HelloWorldApp.java lol im a begginer in java and put the code inside the notepad and save as HelloWorldApp.java and I made a new folder named Java and its located in my documents[br][size=1]Posted on: April 12, 2007, 02:10:45 PM[/size][hr]Ok lemme tell you what I have ok?

Ok SO I have a folder names “Java” and the .bat file in there and the “HelloWorldApp.java” in there as well and I get 2 errors when compiling

[code]
Compiling all java files in directory…

C:\Documents and Settings\caca\My Documents\Java>Javac *.java
Public statis void main(string[] args) {
^

HelloWorldApp.java:7: ‘)’ expected
System.out.printIn(“Hello World!”; // Display the String. ^

2 errors
’ successfully’ is not recognized as an internal or external command operable program or batch file.
Press any key to continue . . .
[/code][br][size=1]Posted on: April 12, 2007, 02:18:27 PM[/size][hr]ANyone help?[/quote]

Java is spelling and case sensitive.

;D[/quote]

Just to elaborate, since he(masterp00n) doesn’t seem to know where to put this, you make a new text file and paste that code in and save it as a .bat file(a batch file is the proper term)

item.title: I need help w/ Java
item.dc:creator: @Yz85Racer Yz85Racer
item.description:
@Yz85Racer wrote:

Is the .java file in your Java directory? Which is e.g for me
C:\program files\java.

Also, have you changed the command promt to set it to your Java directory?

If not, shoot me a pm. I could tell you how, or, you could search java.sun.com or something, I can’t remember.

Actually, I’m bored, so just incase you haven’t I’ll write what to do.

Open command prompt. Then go to your Java directory. Which is for me, open My Computer. Local Disk Drive > Program Files > Java. Then place your .java file in there. And we’re almost set to go.

Then in the command prompt, this is for me, so you might have to change it. So the command promt accesses your Java directory basically. Type this

cd C:\program files\java

Then, type dir in, and you should see.

[code] Directory of C:\Program Files\Java

04/12/2007 10:20 AM .
04/12/2007 10:20 AM …
04/12/2007 10:07 AM jdk1.6.0_01
04/12/2007 10:02 AM 420 ‘Nameofyourfile’.java
04/10/2007 01:00 PM jre1.5.0_07
04/12/2007 10:08 AM jre1.6.0_01
1 File(s) 420 bytes
5 Dir(s) 153,996,316,672 bytes free[/code]
Your java files may differ. By java files I mean;
jre1.6.0_01
Etc.

So then, type;

javac 'NameofFile'.java

Say I was compiling something called Test.java. I would type

javac Test.java.

Read full topic
